message.body: Hey Alex what school are you from
Hello! Most recently, penn. How about you?
I went to penn too but have been out for a few years now
Yeah, I graduated in 2010 and then moved to boston
Are you still in philly?
Yeah I'm still in Philly
What are u up to in bean town
I lived in Philly before I went to penn so I just stuck around after
Right now I'm trying to stay we awake at work after last night's game - i work at a healthcare Improvement non profit
We're kind of like a think tank. We try to find the best ideas and innovations to improve care worldwide and share/scale those ideas
What do you do in the philly
That sounds like a good job.
I do a lot of stuff, much of it art related and some linguistics work
Did you go to undergrad at penn then
Nice - what kind of art? Yes, undergrad at penn
Sculpture, painting and instillation but I like working on collaborative projects
That's awesome - i took a print making class at penn - it was great, my only formal art class
I did some print there when I was in grad school. Was Matt your teacher
I worked with invanco in intaglio printing - matt was doing screen printing at the time though
Ivancho knows his stuff and is a fun guy to have a drink with.
I like intaglio
It's a fun process.
I took a lot of printmaking in undergrad
What do you do in your free time

Invanco is great! Right now it seems like I just work - i was an avid cyclist but hot hot by a car running a stop sign a few months ago and broke my foot- i enjoy music, play guitar, typical stuff - how about you?
But got hit by a car *
Ah that sucks! I've been hit a couple times on my bike. Once an SUV right hooked me and broke my arm and the other time I got doored by a cab and got a bad concussion.
I couldn't ride after that for a couple years.
I'm just starting to ride again, it was scary at first though
I just made a smoothie out of some stuff from the garden and i can hardly drink it.
I put kale, ginger, carrot, parsley and lemon and I way over did it on the ginger and lemon
I added simple syrup to thin it and sweeten it but it is still really harsh
I had lemons and ginger that I wanted to use up and should not have used them all up
It's an intense experience
How's the foot healing?
That all sounds intense - bike crashes, drinks, and all! Foot is ok - i still feel the fracture, especially when running - what do you ride?
Just an 80s schwinn world sport, just single speed, I got it for cheep a while back and the thing is bomb proof
What do you ride
Awesome - i ride a surly cross check - it's a steel frame, also bomb proof, or at least 2011 hyundai proof
Ha!
My roommate had one of those that he just sold.
So what kinda music do u play
I hope to have mine for ever - it's so versatile. I miss riding in philly - it's much more bike friendly there
Beatles, Dr dog, black keys style - blues, pop, rock and the venn diagram that all creates
Are you working on any projects now for art?
Yeah Philly is good for bikes . They keep adding bike lanes and racks and have even changed the laws recently to protect cyclists
I'm working on a couple projects at the moment. One involves casting stuff out of pet hair and making stuff out of trash.
I'm working on a watercolor too but it's been on hold for a bit
Nice, do you have a studio in your home?
I work on some stuff at home but my gallery lets me work there when there is down time
Do you play in any bands or is it just music u play at home
I'd love to be in a band, but never have been - my buddies and i played a lot of music in our apartments during school, but that was mostly upsetting forthe people in my building
Do you know benjy Brooke?
I think it's good to upset people with music once and awhile. No I don't know that person
He also graduated penn - undergrad art degree. He did animation. Figured there was a chance you might have known him
I think I remember his name but I don't remember what his art work was like
BenjyBrooke.com if you're interested. He and another guy are king drippa, they do a lot of music video animation
He did some of the initial designs for litographs - a project of another friend. Litographs.com - they're always looking for new designs too
In case you had ideas for any books
Cool stuff thanks!
